intro: Neogaillonia inopinata, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Neogaillonia inopinata plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
